title: 'Faulty handle design and fabrication.'
body: 'Ordered this particular toolbox after going through the reviews and the Taparia name behind the product. Well I was in for a big disappointment this time. Though the package was intact the product was received in damaged condition. May be a lapse on quality check before dispatch. One of the handles arrived in detached condition from the box. That itself is not an issue. Such things may happen during transit. The pipe used for handles is very very light and the fashion in which it has been bent leaves much to be desired. I could have repaired at my end but I am not sure of the period it will last for.. The lifting handle pipes and the tray supports share common rivets and the length of rivets is short as a result the handle was detached. Another thing is the rivets used to facilitate the movement of trays are far too delicate for my liking. Kindly refer the photographs for reference. When someone orders a toolbox this size then ninety nine percent of the time it has to be a technical person hence the supplier has to be extra careful. The way the handles have been fabricated leaves a doubt in mind regarding the genuineness of the toolbox. As regards the finish it is good but what good is finish if I am unable to carry the tool box to the site with confidence? Finally decided to return the toolbox as I am doubtful about the suitability for the intended purpose. By the way I am a site engineer and have been using tool boxes all my life
column5: so I know exactly what I expect from such items. The two stars are for finishing and painting.'

title: 'Not good at all'
body: 'This is probably the first time I am rating a Taparia product so low. The product is not at all up to the mark. 1. Firstly it was having some dents. It was pretty clear that they did not happen during the shipping process. 2. There were lot of scratches on the base. 3. The paint job was not at all good. Looked pretty cheap. 4. The handles were not aligned properly. 5. The lid was not opening properly. It was grazing the body every time you open it.  I think they have not put a proper quality control or they have turned to making cheaper products for the online market. Disappointed to say the least.'

title: 'Value for Money'
body: No doubt it's a value for money product. As Taparia is known for its no nonsense quality products, this one will also not disappoint the buyers. These kind of boxes are prone for wear and tear over the period of time and I hope it's powder coated paint will last longer than any normal spray paint job. Size is adequate enough but I realized I grew up beyond the league of tool box and will be a new entrant to tool Cabinet because even 30% - 40% of tools on the table didn't fit in the box, leave other power tools aside (no blame the box). Packaging was also good and even attention was paid to add a small styrofoam between it's handle and body otherwise vibration during transportation could have resulted small scratch in that area. One area of concern is that it doesn't have rubber bumpers at bottom but it can be excused as with such load, adhesive based bumper might be just a cosmetic addition and drilling the box for adding screw based bumpers will puncture the case and moisture /water can destroy your precious tools in longer run, so it's something to live with at this moment until Taparia add additional mechanism for the same. While expecting little bit more from the brand, Taparia could have added a thin soft rubber base at the bottom of every campartment. It might raise cost to less than 50 but surely add value to the product because no other brand is offering it. It will just simply reduce the cluttering noise of the tools while hitting the metal body. One last small area of concern is brand sticker, it's couple of mm bigger that the area where it was pasted, Taparia either should change the sticker width or place it somewhere else, or its prone to leave it's surface sooner than expected.  There is no doubt that I will never buy this product again because it seems so sturdy that it will surely last for more than a century...

title: 'Absolutely the best quality and design'
body: 'This is absolutely the finest metal toolbox I have purchased. The metal is thick and sturdy
column5: the powder coating paint is excellent and the ergonomics - open / close mechanism are really well engineered with no play or rattle and very smooth. The box was also factory packed in its own carton with superb poly foam protection so that it reached dent and scratch free. Buy this without hesitation as it will last much longer than crack prone plastic boxes and offer you and much better view of your tools. Super happy with this high quality Taparia toolbox 👏🏼 Other brands such as Plantex etc are made with thinner steel so you will not get the same quality as this product if you decide to buy those . Choose wisely !'
